title: Claude.ai MCP Connector Compatibility
description:
Epic: Enable mcp-http server to work as MCP Connector in Claude.ai

## Overview
Implement RFC9728 Protected Resource Metadata, ProtectedResourceAuth combinator for automatic WWW-Authenticate headers, and verify Dynamic Client Registration for Claude.ai compatibility.

## Key Deliverables
1. ProtectedResourceMetadata type in MCP.Server.Auth
2. ProtectedResourceAuth combinator (framework-level 401 handling with WWW-Authenticate)
3. /.well-known/oauth-protected-resource endpoint
4. resource parameter support (RFC8707)
5. --base-url CLI option for mcp-http

## Architecture
The ProtectedResourceAuth combinator handles 401 responses at the framework level. Apps don't manually handle 401 responses - they get RFC9728-compliant WWW-Authenticate headers automatically.

## Related Files
- Spec: specs/001-claude-mcp-connector/spec.md
- Plan: specs/001-claude-mcp-connector/plan.md
- Tasks: specs/001-claude-mcp-connector/tasks.md
- Data Model: specs/001-claude-mcp-connector/data-model.md

## Success Criteria
- Claude.ai can discover and connect to mcp-http via OAuth flow
- All 401 responses include WWW-Authenticate header (automatic via combinator)
- Full OAuth flow completes successfully

title: US1: Protected Resource Discovery (MVP)

Enable Claude.ai to discover MCP server via RFC9728 Protected Resource Metadata endpoint. The ProtectedResourceAuth combinator handles 401 responses with WWW-Authenticate header automatically.

## Tasks (T015-T020)
- T015: Add ProtectedResourceAPI type for endpoint
- T016: Update OAuthAPI to include ProtectedResourceAPI
- T017: Implement handleProtectedResourceMetadata handler
- T018: Wire handler into oauthServer
- T019: Update MCPAPI type to use ProtectedResourceAuth combinator
- T020: Add ProtectedResourceAuthConfig to server context

## Key Change
The combinator handles 401 + WWW-Authenticate at framework level. No manual 401 handling needed in app code.

## Files to Modify
- src/MCP/Server/HTTP.hs

## Contract
- specs/001-claude-mcp-connector/contracts/oauth-protected-resource.yaml
- specs/001-claude-mcp-connector/contracts/mcp-401-response.yaml

1. Start mcp-http with --oauth
2. GET /.well-known/oauth-protected-resource → valid RFC9728 JSON
